summary: The 'Fighting Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder Act of 2025' addresses the prevalence of PTSD and acute stress disorder among public safety officers. It mandates the Attorney General to propose a program providing state-of-the-art treatment and preventative care to these officers and public safety telecommunicators. The report, due within 150 days of enactment, must include program details, grant conditions for confidentiality, administration strategies, legislative language, and estimated appropriations. The Attorney General will consult with stakeholders during the development of the report.
